RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price$ 8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDYETTA tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and held sway under confident handling. TAM TRICKY away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace from along the rail in the run down the backside, rallied from the inside of INDYETTA entering the final turn, and battled gamely on from along the rail in the drive to prove second best. TOBESUNNY broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to seriously threaten the top pair in the late stages. JUST MISTY was held at the start to get away poorly, raced into a stalking trip from along the rail entering the first turn, maintained her position into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. The stewards conducted an inquiry into the start of the race, in particular in regards to JUST MISTY. Following a review the stewards ordered a full refund on JUST MISTY, as it was deemed she did not receive a fair start.

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.OWNER: Albertson Brian and The Estate of Dennis Tucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Just Misty
ENTRY.OWNER: Claggett Edwin MacPherson Craig and Armstrong Foster
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, tracked rail, faded, declared non starter

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 17 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since April 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Ea ch $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs.BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). BC Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to get up in the final strides. DEPUTY'S DANCER broke sharply and was taken in hand and allowed to settle at the back of the pack entering the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, and closed with a rush three wide in the drive to get up in the closing strides. MONTE away alertly and raced to the lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backstretch, maintained his lead through the final turn and into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late. SELF SERVING lagged well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in deep stretch without having racing room late. EARS TO US away well and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, continued two wide into the final turn, but had little to offer in the late going.

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 w, closed 3 w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Monte
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, clear lead, rallied inside, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Ears to Us
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 17 Allow ed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARLAN'S ANGEL tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing out from the rail, forced the issue two wide from the outside of ANIMA, chased that rival through the final turn, and wore her pace rival down in the final strides to prevail. ANIMA away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of BAKZONE through the stretch the first time, controlled the pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and just failed to last. DONE THAT unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied smartly two wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and closed willingly five wide in the drive to garner a share. CERTIFIABLE broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backside, rallied three wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. BAKZONE away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time eased herself into a tracking trip entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Done That
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, tracked, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Certifiable
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, led, rallied inside, closed rail, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARUNDEL CASTLE away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, was briefly overtaken entering the final turn, battled back from along the rail through the turn and took the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and inched clear late. CHI CHI'S SONG away alertly, but was content to assume a tracking trip one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, maintained her position entering the backstretch, took a narrow advantage entering the final turn, was unable to dispose of the pacesetter through the turn, and finished three wide in the drive to hold the place. ELLAMEISTER broke sharply and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued from a stalking trip into the backside, collared the leader three wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly three out from the rail in the drive to just miss the place. HONOR THE QUEEN trailed a compact field into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, began to lose touch with her rivals in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer over the final furlong. The final sixteenth of a mile in this race was HAND TIMED.

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Honor the Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: Martin Ashley and Braico John F
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Chi Chi's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ellameister
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pr ice $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROKE AN BROKEN away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, continued to battle from the inside of SLOOP JOHN B through the final turn and into the stretch, and inched clear late. SLOOP JOHN B broke sharply and dueled for the lead one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, but finished willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. BETTER TONE rushed up along the rail through the first turn and was forced to steady off heels leaving the turn and entering the stretch the first time, was taken up off heels again both entering and leaving the second turn while continuing to track the leaders, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. TRAPALIS tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued with a three wide trip in the run down the backstretch while maintaining his position, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but was outfinished late while finishing four wide in the drive. TEX TONIC stalked the leaders at the back of a compact field entering the stretch the first time, continued to trail the field in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied repeatedly, tracked rail, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Tex Tonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, close rail, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Trapalis
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 31 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A RaceS ince April 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR. QUALITY away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, and drew clear late. JUST MAKE BELIEVE broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, got shuffled back slightly entering the lane the first time, continued to stalk the leaders in a compact field in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to prove second best. GOOD BYE PUTIN pulled his way through the first turn to gain a tracking trip at the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to save ground through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to garner a share. BABY GRAND away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of MR. QUALITY in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, and faded in the late stages. APPELLANT was slow into stride and trailed the field into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, continued from the back of the pack in the run down the backside, rallied three out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. MORETHANSOULTITLE stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late going.

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PURSUE stalked the early pace into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, advanced smartly three wide midway down the backstretch and assumed command entering the final turn, and drew clear late as much the best. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT broke sharply and raced to the lead while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, was quickly overtaken entering the final turn, rallied two wide through the turn, and finished willingly one out from the rail in the drive to prove easily second best. DESIRED OUTCOME settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed with late interest three wide in the drive to get up for a share. HE'S A SAINT tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was outfinished in deep stretch for the show position. GROOVIN' IS BAK away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the stretch drive. BLACKSTONE away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. TEXAS MOONSHINE lagged well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make his presence felt. MOUNT LOKI unhurried early while racing greenly in the opening strides, trailed well behind the field entering the backstretch, and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Desired Outcome
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Moonshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied rail, even effort

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed 2 w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Blackstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Loki
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, no factor

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3w, advanced 3/8, led, drew clear
